title: Aam Aadmi Party workers detained at IPL cricket match in Delhi for protesting Arvind Kejriwal arrest
content:
The Delhi Police detained at least half a dozen Aam Aadmi Party workers after they shouted slogans in support of arrested Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal during an Indian Premier League cricket match in the national capital on Tuesday, PTI reported.The Aam Aadmi Party chief was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on March 21 for his alleged role in the liquor policy case. He is currently lodged in DelhiтАЩs Tihar Jail.On Tuesday, members of the Aam Aadmi PartyтАЩs student wing, Chhatra Yuva Sangharsh Samiti, wore T-shirts bearing the slogan тАЬJail Ka Jawab Vote Se [reply to the arrest with a vote]тАЭ in protest against KejriwalтАЩs arrest at a match between the Delhi Capitals and the Rajasthan Royals.The workers chanted slogans during the match, PTI quoted a senior police officer as saying.тАЬOur staff are deployed at various points in the stadium,тАЭ the police officer said. тАЬWe have detained some persons for creating public nuisance in one of the stands.
